page.title: 05ST OUEN'S CHURCH
page.content:
This church is the parish church and was built in the South West corner of the parish. It was constructed in granite but the spire is of different construction. It is near St Ouen's Manor and has several brasses commemorating the de Carteret family, a family which has been at the Manor for over 800 years.
As well as having some silver plates which date back to the 17th century it also has an unusual stone staircase which leads from the centre of the church to the belfry.
The church was restored in 1870 and since then has changed very little. There is now a sister church, St Georges, which was built in 1880 at the other end of the Parish at Portinfer.
